org.apache.paimon.data.variant

Interface Variant

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericVariant

    public interface Variant
    A Variant represents a type that contain one of: 1) Primitive: A type and corresponding value (e.g. INT, STRING); 2) Array: An ordered list of Variant values; 3) Object: An unordered collection of string/Variant pairs (i.e. key/value pairs). An object may not contain duplicate keys.

    A Variant is encoded with 2 binary values, the value and the metadata.

    The Variant Binary Encoding allows representation of semi-structured data (e.g. JSON) in a form that can be efficiently queried by path. The design is intended to allow efficient access to nested data even in the presence of very wide or deep structures.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Variant copy()
      Returns a copy of the variant.
      byte[] metadata()
      Returns the variant metadata.
      long sizeInBytes()
      Returns the size of the variant in bytes.
      String toJson()
      Parses the variant to json.
      byte[] value()
      Returns the variant value.
      Object variantGet(String path)
      Extracts a sub-variant value according to a path which start with a `$`.

    • Method Detail

      • metadata

        byte[] metadata()
        Returns the variant metadata.

      • value

        byte[] value()
        Returns the variant value.

      • toJson

        String toJson()
        Parses the variant to json.

      • variantGet

        Object variantGet(String path)
        Extracts a sub-variant value according to a path which start with a `$`. e.g.

        access object's field: `$.key` or `$['key']` or `$["key"]`.

        access array's first elem: `$.array[0]`

      • sizeInBytes

        long sizeInBytes()
        Returns the size of the variant in bytes.

      • copy

        Variant copy()
        Returns a copy of the variant.
